Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2008 11:44AM chilidog25 wrote: Hey there jmfl, There shouldnt be any problem driving to and from. Its a quick process but I do want to warn you that for the few seconds that the dye is being injected (they go in right by the nipple) it is quite painful. I took a deep breath and blew hard out through my mouth until the pinching feeling subsided. You should be fine immediately afterwards. Good luck for tomorrow and Ill be sending warm and fuzzy thoughts your way on Wednesday morning.
Posts.Title: SNB Dye Injection jmfl Jule

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2008 06:16PM chilidog25 wrote: Sounds like I need to get a referral and in the mean time get some pain killers in me. Nerve damage makes sense. I just hope it will repair sooner rather than later. AnneW- Who is a PCP ? Wishiwere - Can they repair nerve damage and why would I need to move fast? Thanks for your input Ladies.
Posts.Title: hand pain post op. chilidog25 wishiwere

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 11:34PM chilidog25 wrote: Just had one of my drains out on Monday. Was told by the nurse to look away, take a deep breath and exhale hard as I can. I was still breathing out hard when she laughed and said 'its already out' so no pain for me. (at least on the that side ) Still got one more to go. Everyone heals so differently. Good luck.
Posts.Title: drain in armpit Passenger59 mason204

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2008 01:26AM chilidog25 wrote: Ive left this post elsewhere but just as a warning, I was given the qball but still had a lot of pain after surgery. I begged for some pain meds but was only allowed 1 vicodin in the nine hours post op. Two days later the qball was removed and they discovered it hadn't released any meds. No one had checked it. I hear its great when it works but make sure its actually working!
Posts.Title: New Kind Of Pain Relief! Marie821 mthomp2020

Posts.Content: chilidog25 wrote: Three weeks ago I had a bilat. mas. with snb. Since leaving the hospital Ive had a constant, cramping, throbbing pain in my right hand that sometimes travels to my elbow. I believe it is coming from the site of the IV but when I told my surgeon about it he didnt see why it would cause a lasting pain. He also ruled out lymph edema because there is no obvious swelling. Im unable to grip a steering wheel, hold a fork or tie my shoes. I am due to return to work (as a hairdresser) on Tuesday but dont think Im going to make it in my present condition. Any thoughts? Any one have a similar experience? chili Dx 3/5/2008, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, 1/4 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
